Apple Scab.description: Apple Scab is a common fungal disease that affects apple and crabapple trees. It causes olive-green or brown spots on leaves, fruit, and twigs.
symptoms: Velvety, olive-green spots on leaves that later turn black.
Leaves may become twisted and puckered.
Dark, scabby spots on fruit, which can crack and become deformed.
prevention: Prune trees in late winter to improve air circulation.
Rake and destroy all fallen leaves in autumn to reduce fungal spores.
Apply appropriate fungicides during the growing season, starting at bud-break.

Apple Healthy.description: The leaf appears to be healthy and free of any visible diseases or pests.
symptoms: Leaf shape is normal for the species.
prevention: Continue good watering, fertilization, and pruning practices.
Monitor regularly for early signs of stress or disease.
Ensure adequate spacing for good air circulation.

Tomato Mosaic Virus.description: A viral infection that affects tomatoes and other plants. It causes mottled light/dark green patterns on leaves and can stunt plant growth.
symptoms: Light and dark green mosaic or mottle patterns on leaves.
Leaves may be curled, distorted, or smaller than normal.
Fruit may be discolored, deformed, or have internal browning.
prevention: There is no cure. Remove and destroy infected plants immediately.
Wash hands and tools thoroughly with soap after handling plants.
Control aphids and other insects that can spread the virus.
Avoid planting in the same spot where diseased plants were.
